description.narrative: Increasing work activation of persons from vulnerable groups and members of groups at risk of social exclusion

participating-org.narrative: GOVERNMENT OF MACEDONIA, THE FORMER YUGO

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: GOVERNMENT OF MACEDONIA, THE FORMER YUGO
GOVERNMENT OF MACEDONIA, THE FORMER YUGO
GOVERNMENT OF MACEDONIA, THE FORMER YUGO
GOVERNMENT OF MACEDONIA, THE FORMER YUGO

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of activated and motivated Roma and other individuals at risk of social exclusion to enter the labour market 1.2 Number of assessments (individual employment plans) developed to support Roma and other individuals at risk of social exclusion to get employment 1.3 Number of unemployed Roma and people at risk of social exclusion engaged in ALMMs 1.4 Number of full-time employments created 1.5 Number of unemployed successfully completed trainings

comment.narrative: 1.1 Number of activated and motivated Roma and other individuals at risk of social exclusion to enter the labour market (2016): 2,882 1.2 Number of assessments (individual employment plans) developed to support Roma and other individuals at risk of social exclusion to get employment (2016): 2,513 1.3 Number of unemployed Roma and people at risk of social exclusion engaged in ALMMs (2016): 541 1.4 Number of full-time employments created (2016): 289 1.5 Number of unemployed successfully completed trainings (2016): 58

1.1 Number of activated and motivated Roma and other individuals at risk of social exclusion to enter the labour market (2017): 3,882 1.2 Number of assessments (individual employment plans) developed to support Roma and other individuals at risk of social exclusion to get employment (2017): 3,300 1.3 Number of unemployed Roma and people at risk of social exclusion engaged in ALMMs (2017): 780 1.4 Number of full-time employments created (2017): 540 1.5 Number of unemployed successfully completed trainings (2017): 100

A comprehensive set of activities for empowering unemployed Roma through coaching and mentorship services continued in 2017. 3 Mentors and 6 coaches were engaged in 12 municipalities to provide individual based support to unemployed persons who are most disadvantaged in the labour market. The outreach of this assistance was further extended in the second half of 2017 when 12 mentors were engaged to cover 18 municipalities. In the second half of 2017, when the programme actually started, in total 500 Roma and other vulnerable persons have been activated. Individual Employment Plans have been prepared for 258 persons, thereof 240 being persons of Roma ethnicity and 155 young persons up to 29 years old. As a result of the mentorship, so far 13 persons have been employed or self-employed and 13 other persons have participated in active labour market measures for improving their employability. The Community Works Programme tackles social exclusion on two fronts at once, offering unemployed people chance to gain valuable working experience and improve their professional skills while providing services for those who are most at risk of social exclusion. The specific activities target several groups of beneficiaries: pre-school children, elderly people, people and children with disabilities as well as citizens of rural areas who are entitled to receive health and/or educational services. The Community Works Programme has become part of the national employment strategy and is one of the active labor market measures of the Operational Plan for Employment. In 2017, 39 municipalities are supported through this measure. Currently, 466 unemployed people are delivering social services at 39 municipalities. Over 7,238 socially excluded people have felt the benefits, as each municipality launched schemes offering part-time job experiences in areas such as elderly care, early childhood development and supporting children and people with disabilities. Out of the 466 people who were engaged on a part-time basis, 87% are women. 140 people were engaged as personal and educational assistants (new service introduced on a country level) providing services to children with disabilities involved in regular primary and secondary schools. In cooperation with Ministry of Education and Science (MES) and other involved institutions, UNDP efforts in 2017 were directed at piloting the operationalization of the process for verification of the informally gained knowledge in 2 key competences (mother language and mathematics). This is part of the bigger support provided for development of flexible primary adult education model. The process is being piloted among juveniles serving prison and Roma. Currently 24 juveniles and 20 Roma are attending classes for literacy and numeracy. Gained experience from the pilot phase, will be beneficial for all involved stakeholders in the process of development of the curricula for other 6 remaining competences which is on-going process. Vocational trainings initiated in the prisons continued in 2017 where additional 46 inmates were trained in prisons Kumanovo and Shtip, thus reaching the number of 120 inmates participating in some vocational training in the period 2016-2017. In addition, in 2017 vocational training started in prison Idrizovo- Female Ward where 17 inmates attend training for seamstress. 36% of the total number of trained inmates are young people up to 29 years, and in terms of level of education, 50% of inmates who completed the vocational training are with only primary education and without any additional qualifications.
